summary: Spider-Man PS4: A Pile of Mediocrity that I Absolutely Love
body:
Spider-Man PS4: A Pile of Mediocrity that I Absolutely Love

Man, fuck me. Like, legit man? FUCK. I love this game, I really REALLY do, but BOI is it not a masterpiece. As a nerd, it’s everything I ever wanted out of a Spider-Man game. As a gamer, it’s a pretty face and nothing more. Please forgive me, as this chucklefuck tears apart something he loves a lot.

Some Chucklefuck’s Thoughts on Spider-Man PS4

1: Silky-ish Smooth Swinging

Ok, first, elephant in the room: How’s the web-swinging? Answer: GREAT. Seriously, this is as good as a Spider-Man game has ever come to flawless web-based city traversal. Granted, there are issues, but they’re more inherent to the mechanic than anything. Web swinging will never not be sloppy at times, but this game refines as well as possible. Hopefully I’m proven wrong in the future. Oh, the combat’s solid too!

2: Marvel’s New York

GOD is it fun to swing around! It’s big and as accurate as it could be with programming limitations and in-universe necessities. One weird thing that’s not an actual issue, but bugs me is Freedom Tower. It’s in the game, it’s approximately where it is in the real city, but it’s not a point of interest in the game. Just seems weird. Overall though, a fantastic rendering of NYC!

3. Awesome Story

GOD it’s really hard to mess up a Spider-Man story on screen! Everything just clicks for the plot overall. To set the stage: Peter Parker is living by himself, working as a scientist and has his Daily Bugle days behind him. As Spider-Man, he’s met all but a handful of his biggest foes. There isn’t really anything out of the ordinary in the game’s canon versus the generally accepted canon (at first anyway.) That’s all I’m willing to say about the story without spoiling.

4. Dare I say “Cookie Cutter?”

Ok, now the shit I hate to say: There’s nothing special about this game. Seriously. There is a metric fuck-ton of love put into this game. Love and a very uninspired formula. The missions are great, but between them? You won’t find a whole lot to wow you.

There’s collectables in the form of backpacks Peter webbed to walls for safe keeping, pigeons to chase, and landmarks (both real and fictional) you take pictures of. There are also challenges to complete which are adequately difficult. There are a couple side missions to do and randomly appearing crimes to halt in your travels as well. There are even a couple things I haven’t mentioned, which makes my complaint sound odd: There isn’t nearly enough to do.

Now, clearly there isn’t NOTHING to do outside the main story, but they’re so simple and repetitive. They’re all just rehashing established mechanics: Fight a bunch of guys, chase a thing through the city, don’t get noticed while doing a thing, etc. None of it is asking anything beyond what you already know you can do. Now there are certain objectives that have to be done in ways you normally wouldn’t do them and that can teach you how to play better or challenge you, but then you just move on. You get points to upgrade certain things buy doing them, but by getting better stuff, the challenge goes down as the game progresses, not up.

At some point, it hit me. This is Marvel’s equivalent of the Batman Arkham games. It’s so similar it’s troubling. Even more troubling, Arkham City did it better.

Which brings me to my biggest complaint about the game:

5. Too Easy

I platinum’d this game in 5 days. Now, that’s not usually a big deal right? Anyone can get a platinum trophy or 1000 gamerscore on a game with enough time and ability, right? Right.

But here’s the thing: I’ve never platinum’d a game in my life.

I’m 22 years old and fell in love with video games before consoles had achievement systems.

Back when I had an Xbox 360, I never got 1000 gamerscore on a single game. This is the first time I ever 100%’d a game and got all its achievements, and I did it within the first week.

Now, I 100% finished (story, side missions, collectibles) the game on normal difficulty the first time. I went back and 100% finished it again on hard and have started my extreme playthrough. I honestly don’t know what changed. A real disappointment.

In Conclusion

This game is entertaining and a real treat for Marvel and Spider-Man fans and there is more than a bit to enjoy! That being said, it does the bare minimum in terms of being a character action game. Combat, traversal, story, all the elements are there, but it’s nothing special.

Having said that, this raises the bar. Now that we aren’t gonna get any superhero movie tie-in games, this game is the absolute minimum of what should be in a superhero characterer action game. It’s strong in fundamentals, faithful to source material, and has an… amount of replay value. It’s a great foundation for the genre, but not its MVP.

TL;DR-

7.8/10 Good, nothing special though.

(Please let me know what you think)

summary:
Teacher: Peter Parkr, can you explain your um family tree?
Peter: Oh yeah sure. So there's Aunt May, Mr. Stark, Dr. Dad, Auntie...
body:
Teacher: Peter Parkr, can you explain your um family tree?
Peter: Oh yeah sure. So there's Aunt May, Mr. Stark, Dr. Dad, Auntie Pepper and Aunt Natasha. Uncle Clint, Uncle Sam, Uncle Thor, Uncle Rhodey, Uncle Scott, and Uncle Bruce. My granddad Bucky and Grandpa Steve. 
Teacher:.....Peter that's just the Avengers minus your Aunt May.
Peter: Oh yeah I haven't even told you my cousins yet, most all aliens.
Teacher: Okay I think that's eno-
Ned: No let him finish!
MJ: I too want know Peter's weird funky cousins.

dialogue.name: Teacher
dialogue.label: Teacher:
dialogue.phrase: Peter Parkr, can you explain your um family tree?

dialogue.name: Peter

dialogue.phrase: Oh yeah sure. So there's Aunt May, Mr. Stark, Dr. Dad, Auntie Pepper and Aunt Natasha. Uncle Clint, Uncle Sam, Uncle Thor, Uncle Rhodey, Uncle Scott, and Uncle Bruce. My granddad Bucky and Grandpa Steve.

dialogue.name: Peter

dialogue.phrase: Oh yeah I haven't even told you my cousins yet, most all aliens.

title: Spideypool Fic Prompts
body: Okay, so I have recently fallen deep into the Spideypool rabbit hole and wish to start writing some fan fiction. I have started trying to write a slow-burn, chaptered fic but I feel like since I have never written for this ship before I need a few one-shots/ short fics to stretch my writing muscles and attempt to get the characterisation right. So, I am taking prompts for inspiration (I will give you a shoutout if I do end up using the idea/incorporating it in some way). For some additional information, I am up to date on Spider-man/Deadpool and have read a fair smattering of new and old Spider-man and Deadpool comics respectively. I have also played both the latest Spider-man game on PS4 and the Deadpool video game (as well as having seen the films- duh). I’m pretty much openminded to most things, though I do only write a 20-something Peter Parker (Not MCU Peter, sorry guys).  So, if you have any ideas or prompts you’re burning to read, either leave a message on this post or leave it in my ask

For some additional information, I am up to date on Spider-man/Deadpool and have read a fair smattering of new and old Spider-man and Deadpool comics respectively. I have also played both the latest Spider-man game on PS4 and the Deadpool video game (as well as having seen the films- duh). I’m pretty much openminded to most things, though I do only write a 20-something Peter Parker (Not MCU Peter, sorry guys).  So, if you have any ideas or prompts you’re burning to read, either leave a message on this post or leave it in my ask

trail.content_raw: Okay, so I have recently fallen deep into the Spideypool rabbit hole and wish to start writing some fan fiction. I have started trying to write a slow-burn, chaptered fic but I feel like since I have never written for this ship before I need a few one-shots/ short fics to stretch my writing muscles and attempt to get the characterisation right. So, I am taking prompts for inspiration (I will give you a shoutout if I do end up using the idea/incorporating it in some way). For some additional information, I am up to date on Spider-man/Deadpool and have read a fair smattering of new and old Spider-man and Deadpool comics respectively. I have also played both the latest Spider-man game on PS4 and the Deadpool video game (as well as having seen the films- duh). I’m pretty much openminded to most things, though I do only write a 20-something Peter Parker (Not MCU Peter, sorry guys).  So, if you have any ideas or prompts you’re burning to read, either leave a message on this post or leave it in my ask
trail.content: Okay, so I have recently fallen deep into the Spideypool rabbit hole and wish to start writing some fan fiction. I have started trying to write a slow-burn, chaptered fic but I feel like since I have never written for this ship before I need a few one-shots/ short fics to stretch my writing muscles and attempt to get the characterisation right. So, I am taking prompts for inspiration (I will give you a shoutout if I do end up using the idea/incorporating it in some way). For some additional information, I am up to date on Spider-man/Deadpool and have read a fair smattering of new and old Spider-man and Deadpool comics respectively. I have also played both the latest Spider-man game on PS4 and the Deadpool video game (as well as having seen the films- duh). I’m pretty much openminded to most things, though I do only write a 20-something Peter Parker (Not MCU Peter, sorry guys).  So, if you have any ideas or prompts you’re burning to read, either leave a message on this post or leave it in my ask

summary: I really hope Sony is setting up a liveaction Spiderverse movie. and hopefully they use all the spider totems from into...
body: I really hope Sony is setting up a liveaction Spiderverse movie. and hopefully they use all the spider totems from into spiderverse although with their different animation styles might be difficult to translate to liveaction but I am sure they can figure something out.
